patients.phenotype: hATTR amyloidosis, typically infiltrates the heart

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The most common hereditary amyloidosis is caused by pathogenic variants in the TTR gene (hATTR amyloidosis), which typically infiltrates the heart.

functional_data.summary: Pathogenic variants in TTR lead to amyloid deposition, primarily affecting cardiac function.

variants.additional_notes: The paper discusses the implications of TTR variants in hereditary amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The most common hereditary amyloidosis is caused by pathogenic variants in the TTR gene (hATTR amyloidosis), which typically infiltrates the heart.
